li.span: Get your Berkshire News: Follow us on Twitter @Badger_NewsÂ
Berkshire Local Schools areÂ closed from Monday, 3/16 until Friday, 4/3Â per Ohio governor's order.
The Junior class Honey Baked Ham Sale is canceled due to school closure.
All activities are canceled during school closure (March 16-April 3)
School and school activities will resume Monday, April 6.
See the District Calendar on the bottom right for more dates!Â
Download the SchoolPointe App on your smartphone/tablet to access Berkshire Schools website w/oÂ a browser!

div.a: Ledgemont Instructors Making Visits to Deliver Home Learning Bags

span.p: Late last week, Kindergarten teachers Mrs. Michelle Sivillo and Miss Sue Reno along with Interim Principal Joy Reed hand delivered âlearning bagsâ to the buildingâs youngest students so that they would have their needed instructional resources.Â

Berkshire High School Art Projects Share Hope at Hospitals During School Closure

span.p: Berkshire High and Junior High School art students have found a way to continue their creative expressions while helping those most in need during the school closure period.Â

a.title: Click to read more about: Berkshire High School Art Projects Share Hope at Hospitals During School Closure

div.a: Read More about Berkshire High School Art Projects Share Hope at Hospitals During School Closure
Burton Elementary School Newspaper Proves Badgers Have Grit

span.p: Burton Elementary School has taken the initiative and love for their school district to a new level with the continuation of The Badger Times, a student-created newspaper developed by 6th grade students.Â

a.title: Click to read more about: Burton Elementary School Newspaper Proves Badgers Have Grit

div.a: Read More about Burton Elementary School Newspaper Proves Badgers Have Grit
Ledgemont Elementary Project Prompts Students to Spread Positivity and Cheer

span.p: Third Grade students at Ledgemont Elementary School have been hard at work identifying opportunities to spread cheer and happiness in and around the community by researching recommended online resources such as Newsela.com during the quarantine by drawing rainbows for others to enjoy.Â Â
